intro: Pilosella longisquama, commonly known as the long-hairy groundsel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of silver-gray, hairy leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils, preferring full sun. Pilosella longisquama is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in disturbed or arid environments.
